extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 8.4: Why did the United States find it difficult to avoid military conflict during this period?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Analyze 08 03

config.question: Which of the following most likely would have motivated some of the War Hawks who supported the conflict that became the War of 1812?

choices.content: the prospect of trade with France
the presence of Federalist support in New England
Britain’s ban on the slave trade

answer_3.response: Consider This: Canada supplied Britain’s Caribbean possessions with foodstuffs. The president reasoned, therefore, that by threatening to seize Canada, the Americans might compel the British to make concessions on maritime issues. See L.O. 8.4 Why did the United States find it difficult to avoid military conflict during this period?
